ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: About loot order
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah. Sometimes you group with the only people available though. Like in Highpass if you need in a group you re stuck with the people camping the room you want
ygData.messageBody:
Yeah. Sometimes you group with the only people available though. Like in
Highpass if you need in a group you're stuck with the people camping the
room you want to camp.
I've had mostly good experiences with looting but there are a few people
who've given me trouble. One thing that pissed me off-- I was group leader
and had alpha loot established. My computer crashed. When i logged back in
there was a new group leader. Despite the fact that I had been at the spawn
point first and had established the group, he felt that bc he had reinvited
people that he was now in charge. He said it was FFA -- ninja loot.
When I asked them to allow me to loot just once corpse he told me I could if
I was fast enough. Often while I was busy healing him he'd go loot
something. When it was clear he didn't appreciate my help, I left. I mean, I
need money to buy spells and stuff.
luv,
-Su

> I, too, play a main healer (cleric), and have encountered this many
> times. I either decide that the experience is worth it and miss out
> on looting, or I quit the group and look for another. The tanks
> won't appreciate what you bring to the group until you are gone.
> Also, while there are more of the type looter you describe in the
> game, there are many who strive to be fair and succeed. Perhaps you
> should choose your friends more wisely...
>
> Just my 2 cp worth...
>
> Paul
>
>
> --- In EverQuest@y..., "Su" <suceress@s...> wrote:
> > Recently in some of the groups I've been in, we've had a few
> problems with
> > loot order. Often, the tanks will insist on FFA. But since I play
> the main
> > healer and am expected to sit and med (only getting up to heal) I
> get
> > totally screwed. I never get loot. But then when we try to
> establish alpha
> > loot some people complain. They don't care about the casters. All
> they care
> > about is getting loot for themselves. These people partake in
> > "ninja-looting". They loot everything really fast so nobody else
> gets a
> > chance. And even when we establish a regular loot order some people
> will
> > still loot out of turn.
> > And then we have times when people say we roll for certain types of
> loot.
> > When I first joined a group, this one guy told me it was ffa (and
> he was a
> > ninja-looter) but that "bronze" and ore were rolled for. I saw that
> he
> > picked up an FS morning star and wanted to roll for it (bc it's an
> expensive
> > item). He said no, it was only for bronze, not FS. So later he
> picked up a
> > bronze weapon. I said, "ok, let's roll for it". He said, "no,
> that's only
> > for bronze armor"...
> > Has anyone else had this problem?
> > What do you think is the best and fairest loot order?
> > Just wondering.
> > luv,
> > -Su
> > ps. alpha loot with 3 loots per turn (per person) works pretty well
> when
> > people cooperate.
